paragraphs.body: When an article is granted featured status, should the A class icon be left or should it be removed? I just saw an article with both of them. If it stays, someone has to add A class icon to all featured articles. Omnibender - Talk - Contributions 20:13, 16 April 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: When an article is granted featured status, should the A class icon be left or should it be removed? I just saw an article with both of them. If it stays, someone has to add A class icon to all featured articles. Omnibender - Talk - Contributions 20:13, 16 April 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Yes, I think we should remove A-class from all FAs.  A featured article is a higher honor than an A-class.  So, we shouldn't need both icons. Mattkenn3 Talk 20:18, 16 April 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: Yes, I think we should remove A-class from all FAs.  A featured article is a higher honor than an A-class.  So, we shouldn't need both icons. Mattkenn3 Talk 20:18, 16 April 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Actually, some Featured Articles aren't A-class, so we would be unable to decipher whether an article that has been featured is A-class. An example would be ${link_0}. Its been featured, but it is no were near the standard of ${link_1} or ${link_2}. So, removing the icon might not be the best idea. Vaznock - Talk 20:31, 16 April 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: Actually, some Featured Articles aren't A-class, so we would be unable to decipher whether an article that has been featured is A-class. An example would be Mongke. Its been featured, but it is no were near the standard of Aang or Military of the Fire Nation. So, removing the icon might not be the best idea. Vaznock - Talk 20:31, 16 April 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: What you people don't understand is that a featured article is supposed to be the highest quality of article in the wiki.  We can demote a featured article if it is not worthy. Mattkenn3 Talk 20:33, 16 April 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: What you people don't understand is that a featured article is supposed to be the highest quality of article in the wiki.  We can demote a featured article if it is not worthy. Mattkenn3 Talk 20:33, 16 April 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: No, we can't. Its been decided that we can't demote FA. And who are you referring to by "you people"? It has been discussed that FAs can't be demoted. Plus, Featured Articles are not the highest quality articles. They were just featured a while ago before better articles came in. Vaznock - Talk 20:36, 16 April 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: No, we can't. Its been decided that we can't demote FA. And who are you referring to by "you people"? It has been discussed that FAs can't be demoted. Plus, Featured Articles are not the highest quality articles. They were just featured a while ago before better articles came in. Vaznock - Talk 20:36, 16 April 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: I introduced the featured status to this wiki.  I explained how the normal FA is chosen, and even left a grading scheme to better explain it.  The community didn't understand and, while I was gone, began giving away FAs.  An A-class Article is viewed as a very nice article.  But, they should not be put over FAs.  In most wikis, FAs are the A-class articles.  Most featured articles haven't even been shown on the main page.  FA isn't just a title, it is a level of recognition, showing that the article is the highest quality and among the finest on the wiki.  They don't even have to have been shown on the Main Page.  This is on most other wikis.  I think it is how it should be done here, too.  But, it is not. Mattkenn3 Talk 21:13, 16 April 2009 (UTC)
paragraphs.text: I introduced the featured status to this wiki.  I explained how the normal FA is chosen, and even left a grading scheme to better explain it.  The community didn't understand and, while I was gone, began giving away FAs.  An A-class Article is viewed as a very nice article.  But, they should not be put over FAs.  In most wikis, FAs are the A-class articles.  Most featured articles haven't even been shown on the main page.  FA isn't just a title, it is a level of recognition, showing that the article is the highest quality and among the finest on the wiki.  They don't even have to have been shown on the Main Page.  This is on most other wikis.  I think it is how it should be done here, too.  But, it is not. Mattkenn3 Talk 21:13, 16 April 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: I know a lot of you archive by moving your old talk pages to a subpage, but please don't do this for project pages. All project pages have been archived the same way across the wiki. The correct way to archive for project pages is to cut and paste old threads by hand into a page designated as an archive. This preserves the history correctly. The 888th Avatar (talk) 11:50, January 19, 2011 (UTC)
